subject: Mental Health
title: Childhood Adversity
description: A micro-lesson that makes Childhood Adversity usable.

hook.text: Children who experience abuse or neglect carry a shadow long after the bruises heal.

buildup.text: Adverse childhood experiences, or ACEs, dramatically raise lifetime depression risk.

discovery.text: Toxic stress in childhood rewires the developing brain's stress response system.

twist.text: Four or more ACEs triple the risk of adult depression compared to zero.

climax.text: Early intervention can buffer these effects before the brain fully sets its patterns.

punchline.text: What happens to a child echoes in the adult's brain.
